headline: Firefly’s Initial Wall Street Ratings Highlight Hope, and Uncertainty
summary: The space technology start-up  Firefly Aerospace  has potential, and some risks.  The company also has contracts with defense contractors, such as  Lockheed Martin L3Harris Technologies  and  Northrop Grumman  which has invested $50 million in it.  Firefly raised almost $900 million, selling shares at $45 apiece in its IPO, completed on Aug. 7.

raw.headline: Firefly’s Initial Wall Street Ratings Highlight Hope, and Uncertainty

headline: Wall Street launches coverage of Firefly Aerospace with mixed views
summary: Investing.com -- Wall Street analysts initiated coverage of Firefly Aerospace, with opinions split between optimism on the company’s growth prospects in the crowded launch sector and caution over technical execution risks.

raw.headline: Wall Street launches coverage of Firefly Aerospace with mixed views

headline: The Hypersonic Race: How Lockheed Is Driving the Future of War
